data.title: Foundation — Blair House
data.text:
About The Foundation

Founded in 1985, the Blair House Foundation is a charitable, tax-exempt, non-partisan organization committed to raising private funds from across the nation to create and maintain the beautiful rooms, gardens, and amenities of Blair House.

Government funding supports the staffing and structural needs of Blair House, but it is the Foundation’s responsibility to preserve and refresh the furnishings, décor, fine arts, and gardens. Through the generosity of American individuals, foundations, and corporations, the Foundation is able to ensure Blair House remains a beautiful and welcoming home away from home for world leaders.

Or you may also send a check to the following address:

Blair House Foundation

Post Office Box 27208

Washington, DC 20038

Please make checks payable to the Blair House Foundation.

The Blair House Foundation’s Commitment to its Donors:

We will not sell, share or trade our donors' names or personal information with any other entity, nor send mailings to our donors on behalf of other organizations. This policy applies to all information received by the Blair House Foundation, both online and offline, on any Platform ('Platform', includes the Blair House website and mobile applications), as well as any electronic, written, or oral communications.

Donations to Blair House are tax-deductible to the extent of the law by virtue of the Foundation’s status as a tax-exempt, non-profit charitable organization under Section 501(c)(3) of the IRS Code.

The Blair House Foundation's annual IRS 990 filing is available upon request: info@blairhousefund.org

Blair House is not open to the public.
